result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:01 PM - cases called - 20CF54 (adjourned initial appearance), 22CF129 (adjourned initial appearance), 22CF195 (adjourned initial appearance), 22CF240 (adjourned initial appearance), 21CF138 (tracking), 21CF333 (tracking), 21CF340 (tracking), and 22CF41 (tracking).  Defendant Lucas A Waltenberg appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Lucas A Waltenberg.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court notes no victims appeared.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg - in receipt of complaints - waive readings - waives time limits for scheduling the preliminary hearing - request for bond reduction.  Response by Atty Polzin regarding bond modification.  Court continues the $100 cash bonds.  Court lowers the $500 cash bond in 22CF240 to $100 (total for release is $500.00).  Court accepts waiver of time limits.

records.addlTxt: from the Defendant to the Court
Adjourned initial appearance on September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:41 AM - cases called - 21CF333, 21CF138, 21CF340, 22CF41, 22CF129, 22CF195 and 22CF240.  Defendant Lucas A Waltenberg appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Laufenberg is not available for today's hearing.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court addresses Defendant.  Defendant has been trying to contact the public defender's office.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court sets bond in 22CF195 and 22CF129.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:46 PM - case called.  Defendant Lucas A Waltenberg appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of this matter.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions Defendant regarding bond.  Responses by Defendant.
